name: places/ChIJd9SVAZ5ZwokRXLt9ahRzUVE
adrFormatAddress: 217 1st Ave., New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Prepared foods, custom sandwiches & coffee are the focus at this grocery store with delivery.

originalText.text: Incredible bodega. The sandwiches are so good and the selection of snacks & drinks is really impressive for the little space they have. The chopped cheeses were a little dissapointing but they did have to make 12 of them. Really enjoyed giving this place my business.

text.text: Incredible bodega. The sandwiches are so good and the selection of snacks & drinks is really impressive for the little space they have. The chopped cheeses were a little dissapointing but they did have to make 12 of them. Really enjoyed giving this place my business.

originalText.text:
Found chunks of hard sharp plastic in my food, the place is clearly not sanitary and likely will get closed by the health department. What's worse is after I called to tell them to complain instead of being apologetic the manager said okay if you come tomorrow I will give a pancake. I didn't feel comfortable eating anything after chunks of dangerous plastic in one item and wanted a refund on my whole meal, I am not going to play roulette with my families health and just hope nothing else has plastic in it but the manager didn't seem to get
that.

originalText.text:
Nice clean place, Good food and friendly crews!  Its a deli with good healthy options like fresh fruits, subs and sandwiches!

They have a mini grocery but i think they do better with their food on the fly and they have a small kitchen behind the counter where food and cooked fresh as one orders!

They have smoothies, juice, soup, coffee, panini, sandwhiches, and much more!

originalText.text: Bought a slice of cake and thought it tasted funny. Was eating in the dark realized I had a mouth of mold YUCK god knows how long that cakes been sitting there. Health department WILL be contacted! As if 8 dollars for a slice wasn’t sick enough… get those fridges checked ASAP!!!

text.text: Bought a slice of cake and thought it tasted funny. Was eating in the dark realized I had a mouth of mold YUCK god knows how long that cakes been sitting there. Health department WILL be contacted! As if 8 dollars for a slice wasn’t sick enough… get those fridges checked ASAP!!!

originalText.text:
I ordered a salami sandwich with swiss cheese mustard and mayo.
I got to the counter and was charged $9.40 for it.  I thought about returning it , but said to myself if it's good , I won't mind that much.  Well, I took it home, and it was not only not good , it was disgusting and inedible.  The gentleman who made the sandwich perhaps heard me say slobber it with mustard and mayonnaise .
When the mustard and mayo was so prevalent you could see if from the sideview.   Way too much , rendering the sandwich inedible.  So I figured I'll take the meat and cheese out of the sandwich and eat that.   TWO thin slices of salami and maybe two pieces of swiss cheese!
I hate to complain, and certainly my goal is not to get anyone in trouble.   If you are going to charge that much money that should cost 5 or 6 dollars at the most, make it good and make it at least be substantial enough to get the daily required amount of vit and nutrients from salami and cheese.  Then when I called , the cashier put me on hold for 10 minutes!     I finally hung up!
